snippet: The Houthis’ acceptance of the cease-fire came as a Saudi-led coalition bombed the residence of Ali Abdullah Saleh, Yemen’s former president and a Houthi ally.
abstract: Houthi rebels in Yemen agree to Saudi Arabia's proposed five-day cease-fire, pause that would allow delivery of humanitarian relief supplies; Saudi Arabia, however, escalates bombing campaign ahead of truce in effort to inflict maximum damage on rebels before cease-fire takes hold.

byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The Houthis’ acceptance of the cease-fire came as a Saudi-led coalition bombed the residence of Ali Abdullah Saleh, Yemen’s former president and a Houthi ally.

headline.main: Houthi Rebels Agree to 5-Day Cease-Fire in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Houthis Agree to Cease-Fire for Five Days in Yemen
